message.content:
cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.SD 

The paper deals with the problem of analyzing text and links in data sets, which is a common problem in several sub-fields of computer science. However, the focus on scalable models and algorithms for inference suggests that the paper is most likely to belong to the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The use of topic modeling and community detection also suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-categories of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) and Natural Language Processing (cs.CL). The use of statistical physics methods for modeling the mixed-membership block model suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of Statistical Mechanics (cs.SD). Finally, the focus on analyzing networks of documents and links suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
